elements.name: log-record
elements.title: Log Record
elements.description: Log Record element allows to configure a message that will be logged for selected logging level

hidden.name: logLevel
hidden.title: Log Level
hidden.description: Specifies the type of the message that will be logged to microservice log

hidden.name: sender
hidden.title: Sender
hidden.description: Specifies custom system name that sends a request

hidden.name: receiver
hidden.title: Receiver
hidden.description: Specifies custom system name that accepts a request

hidden.name: businessIdentifiers
hidden.title: Business Identifiers
hidden.description: List of business identifiers to be logged

hidden.name: message
hidden.title: Message
hidden.description: A custom message to be logged

elements.name: split-2
elements.title: Split
elements.description: Module that allows to start several processes

common.name: timeout
common.title: Timeout
common.description: Sets a total timeout specified in millis

common.name: stopOnException
common.title: Stop On Exception
common.description: Stop further processing if an exception or failure occurred during processing

hidden.name: aggregationStrategy
hidden.title: Aggregation Strategy
hidden.description: Define reference to Aggregation processor

elements.name: condition
elements.title: Condition
elements.description: Condition allows to route messages to the correct destination based on the contents

common.name: reuseReference
common.title: Reuse Reference
common.description: Reference to Reuse Container element

common.name: loopIndexPropertyName
common.title: Loop iteration index property
common.description: If set, holds a name of the property storing zero-based index of the current iteration. The property holding iteration index is removing after loop exits.

common.name: maxLoopIteration
common.title: Maximum iteration count
common.description: When specified number of iterations is reached, chain stops processing and throw an error.

elements.name: http-trigger
elements.title: HTTP Trigger
elements.description: HTTP Trigger provides an HTTP endpoint for consuming arriving HTTP requests

advanced.name: chunked
advanced.title: Chunked
advanced.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

advanced.name: externalRoute
advanced.title: External route
advanced.description: If checked, HTTP trigger will be registered as "external" on public gateway. Checkbox is inactive when default route registration is disabled in global environment settings.

advanced.name: privateRoute
advanced.title: Private route
advanced.description: If checked, HTTP trigger will be registered as "Private" on private gateway. Checkbox is inactive when default route registration is disabled in global environment settings.

advanced.name: responseFilter
advanced.title: Response filter
advanced.description: Turns on ability to handle additional query parameters "fields" and "excludeFields" to include only specific fields in response or exclude them from there. This is only supported for responses in JSON.

advanced.name: connectTimeout
advanced.title: Connection timeout (ms)
advanced.description: Specifies connection timeout in millis (default value will be used if nothing is given)

advanced.name: killSessionOnTimeout
advanced.title: Terminate session on connection timeout
advanced.description: If checked, connection timeout will trigger session termination process. Chain session might not be finished.

hidden.name: abacResource
hidden.title: Resource
hidden.description: ABAC resource, usually the same as the trigger URI

hidden.name: roles
hidden.title: Roles
hidden.description: Allowed user roles to access HTTP trigger

hidden.name: validationSchema
hidden.title: Json Request Schema
hidden.description: Schema for input message validation

hidden.name: rejectRequestIfNonNullBodyGetDelete
hidden.title: Reject request if body is not empty for GET, DELETE methods
hidden.description: Incoming request will be rejected with an error, if body is received for GET and DELETE methods

hidden.name: allowedContentTypes
hidden.title: Allowed Content Types
hidden.description: If no content types defined - validation disabled

queryProperties.name: chunked
queryProperties.title: Chunked
queryProperties.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

elements.title: AsyncAPI Trigger
elements.description: Receives a call from a service registered in API Repository

hidden.name: integrationOperationProtocolType
hidden.title: Integration Operation Protocol Type
hidden.description: Specifies which type Protocol use the operation

hidden.name: jsonRequestSchema
hidden.title: Json Request Schema
hidden.description: Schema for input message validation

hidden.name: requestFilterHeaderAllowlist
hidden.title: Filter Header Allowlist
hidden.description: List of header names which will be used to filter incoming messages

hidden.name: acknowledgeMode
hidden.title: Acknowledge Mode
hidden.description: NONE - no acknowledgment will be sent. MANUAL - immediately send an acknowledgment (normal or negative) when message is taken. AUTO - send an acknowledgment (normal or negative) after the end of the chain.

advanced.description: The max number of messages to receive from the server in a single API call

advanced.name: synchronousPullRetryableCodes
advanced.title: Retryable error codes
advanced.description: Comma-separated list of additional retryable error codes for synchronous pull.

advanced.name: ackMode
advanced.title: Ack mode
advanced.description: AUTO = exchange gets ack/nack on completion. NONE = downstream process has to ack/nack explicitly

common.description: Specifies delay between reconnection in millis

advanced.name: sslProtocol
advanced.title: SSL Protocol
advanced.description: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases

advanced.name: sslEndpointAlgorithm
advanced.title: SSL endpoint algorithm
advanced.description: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server certificate.

advanced.name: autoOffsetReset
advanced.title: Auto Offset Reset
advanced.description: The schema to adjust the message outset

advanced.name: consumersCount
advanced.title: Consumers Count
advanced.description: The number of consumers that connect to kafka server

advanced.name: keyDeserializer
advanced.title: Key Deserializer
advanced.description: Key deserializer class

advanced.name: valueDeserializer
advanced.title: Value Deserializer
advanced.description: Value deserializer class

advanced.name: maxPollRecords
advanced.title: Max Poll Records
advanced.description: The number of records that will be fetched from the broker as a single batch.

advanced.name: maxPollIntervalMs
advanced.title: Max Poll Interval
advanced.description: The maximum delay between batch polls of records from the broker, in milliseconds. If poll is not performed within given time frame, then the consumer is considered to be failed. In case of failure detection, related consumer group will re-balance to reassign the partitions to another consumer in the group. This "new" consumer will process the whole batch all over again.

elements.name: http-sender
elements.title: HTTP Sender
elements.description: Make a call to a specified URI on external system

common.name: methodComponent
common.title: HTTP Method
common.description: HTTP method

common.name: uri
common.title: URI
common.description: URI format: https://example.com:443/test. Port is optional parameter (default ports - HTTP: 80, HTTPS: 443)

common.name: connectTimeout
common.title: Connection timeout (ms)
common.description: Specifies connection timeout in millis (default value will be used if nothing is given)

advanced.name: isExternalCall
advanced.title: External call
advanced.description: If checked, then communication is done via Egress gateway. Both HTTP and HTTPS are allowed. When default registration of routes is disabled via global environment settings, it is required to manually configure these routes to properly invoke specified endpoint.

advanced.name: m2m
advanced.title: Enable M2M Security
advanced.description: Specifies whether M2M token should be used to make a call

advanced.name: reuseEstablishedConnection
advanced.title: Reuse established connection
advanced.description: If checked - HTTP client will use the connection for multiple requests

advanced.name: propagateContext
advanced.title: Propagate context
advanced.description: Propagate context to headers before sending message

hidden.name: overrideContextParams
hidden.title: Override context parameters
hidden.description: Propagate props to headers before sending message

queryProperties.name: connectTimeout
queryProperties.title: Connection timeout (ms)
queryProperties.description: Specifies connection timeout in millis (default value will be used if nothing is given)

elements.name: mail-sender
elements.title: Mail Sender
elements.description: Send mail using external mail server

common.name: url
common.title: URL
common.description: Mail server URI in format: {protocol}://{host}:{port}. Supported protocols are SMTP and SMTPS (secure variant of SMTP layered over SSL). Default ports are 25 for SMTP, and 465 for SMTPS.

common.name: from
common.title: From
common.description: The From email address.

common.name: to
common.title: To
common.description: The To email addresses. Setting the To email addresses in the header takes precedence over this option. In this case any CC and BCC settings are also retrieved from headers.

common.name: replyTo
common.title: Reply-To
common.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail).

common.name: cc
common.title: CC
common.description: The CC email address.

common.name: bcc
common.title: BCC
common.description: The BCC email address.

common.name: subject
common.title: Subject
common.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

common.name: username
common.title: Username
common.description: The username for login.

common.name: password
common.title: Password
common.description: The password for login. For security purposes, use reference to secured variables when entering passwords

advanced.name: connectionTimeout
advanced.title: Connection timeout (ms)
advanced.description: Connection timeout in millis (default value will be used if nothing is given)

advanced.name: contentType
advanced.title: Content Type
advanced.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

advanced.name: alternativeBodyHeader
advanced.title: Alternative body header
advanced.description: Specifies the header that contains an alternative email body. For example, if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients, set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

advanced.name: useInlineAttachments
advanced.title: Use inline attachments
advanced.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

advanced.name: ignoreUnsupportedCharset
advanced.title: Ignore unsupported charset
advanced.description: Ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

advanced.name: propagateContext
advanced.title: Propagate context
advanced.description: Propagate context to headers before sending message

hidden.title: Override context parameters
hidden.description: Propagate props to headers before sending message

elements.name: swimlane

elements.description: Group elements, that will be represented in UI as Swimlanes

hidden.name: color
hidden.title: Color
hidden.description: Color of Swimlane

common.name: exception
common.title: Exception
common.description: Exception that should be handled

common.name: priority
common.title: Priority
common.description: Determines the order of the catch blocks. The lower the number, the earlier the exception will be handled. For general exception classes such as Exception, you need to set a big number.

common.name: splitName
common.title: Split Name
common.description: Define identifier for subchain. Used as name prefix while propagating headers and properties.

common.name: propagateHeaders
common.title: Propagate headers
common.description: Propagate headers from this branch. Split name is used as header name prefix.

common.name: propagateProperties
common.title: Propagate properties
common.description: Propagate properties from this branch. Split name is used as property name prefix.

common.name: condition
common.title: Condition
common.description: Predicate written using Simple language

common.name: priorityNumber
common.title: Priority number
common.description: Determines the order of the when blocks.

common.name: splitName
common.title: Split Name
common.description: Define identifier for subchain

common.name: failureRateThreshold
common.title: Failure rate threshold (%)
common.description: Configures the failure rate threshold in percentage. If the failure rate is equal or greater than the threshold the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100.

common.name: permittedNumberOfCallsInHalfOpenState
common.title: Permitted number of calls in half open state
common.description: Configures the number of permitted calls when the CircuitBreaker is half open. The size must be greater than 0

common.name: slidingWindowSize
common.title: Sliding window size
common.description: Configures the size of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed. Sliding window can either be count-based or time-based. If slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the last slidingWindowSize calls are recorded and aggregated. If slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, the calls of the last slidingWindowSize seconds are recorded and aggregated. If the "Sliding window type" is COUNT_BASED, the "Minimum number of calls" cannot be greater than "Sliding window size"

common.name: minimumNumberOfCalls
common.title: Minimum number of calls
common.description: Configures the minimum number of calls which are required (per sliding window period) before the CircuitBreaker can calculate the error rate. For example, if "Minimum number of calls" is 10, then at least 10 calls must be recorded, before the failure rate can be calculated. If only 9 calls have been recorded the CircuitBreaker will not transition to open even if all 9 calls have failed

common.name: waitDurationInOpenState
common.title: Wait duration in open state (s)
common.description: Configures the wait duration (in seconds) which specifies how long the CircuitBreaker should stay open, before it switches to half open

common.name: automaticTransitionFromOpenToHalfOpenEnabled
common.title: Automatic transition from open to half open state
common.description: Enables automatic transition from OPEN to HALF_OPEN state once the "Wait duration in open state" has passed

common.name: slowCallDurationThreshold
common.title: Slow call duration threshold (s)
common.description: Configures the duration threshold (seconds) above which calls are considered as slow and increase the slow calls percentage

common.name: slowCallRateThreshold
common.title: Slow call rate threshold (%)
common.description: Configures a threshold in percentage. The CircuitBreaker considers a call as slow when the call duration is greater than "Slow call duration threshold" duration. When the percentage of slow calls is equal or greater the threshold, the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls

common.name: expression
common.title: Expression
common.description: Loop count or stop condition

common.name: doWhile
common.title: Use stop condition in expression field

common.name: splitName
common.title: Split Name
common.description: Define identifier for subchain. Used as name prefix while propagating headers and properties.

common.name: propagateHeaders
common.title: Propagate headers
common.description: Propagate headers from this branch. Split name is used as header name prefix.

common.name: propagateProperties
common.title: Propagate properties
common.description: Propagate properties from this branch. Split name is used as property name prefix.
